content:
• Thursday, April 19, 2012
  • LSCC

    More on Lattice Semiconductor (NASDAQ:LSCC): Q1 misses on all counts as margins and revenues...

    More on Lattice Semiconductor (NASDAQ:LSCC): Q1 misses on all counts as margins and revenues slide. The company also says revenue from the current quarter will range from $72M - $75M. Street expectations are for revenue of $77M. Shares -4.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:17 PM
  • MU

    Micron (NASDAQ:MU) is down 3.6% AH following NAND flash memory rival SanDisk's Q1 miss and bleak...

    Micron (NASDAQ:MU) is down 3.6% AH following NAND flash memory rival SanDisk's Q1 miss and bleak guidance. Most PC industry names are largely unchanged following Microsoft's FQ3 beat, which was fueled by solid Windows and Office sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:43 PM
  • VMI

    More on Valmont Industries (NYSE:VMI): Q1 beats Street estimates on surging growth in its...

    More on Valmont Industries (NYSE:VMI): Q1 beats Street estimates on surging growth in its utility-support and irrigation businesses. Revenue jumped 26% Y/Y, as margins were bolstered by a 17% increase in sales in its engineered infrastructure unit and a 52% jump in sales from its utility-tower segment. Shares +5.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:30 PM
  • JMBA

    Jamba (NASDAQ:JMBA) says it will buy the product formulation and intellectual property for its...

    Jamba (NASDAQ:JMBA) says it will buy the product formulation and intellectual property for its Jamba All-Natural Energy Drink from Nestle (OTCPK:NSRGY) as part of its consumer products expansion plan. Jamba had collaborated with Nestle USA to launch the drink in the Northeast but now plans to expand its availability outside of the region. Shares -2.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM
  • VMI

    Valmont Industries (NYSE:VMI): Q1 EPS of $1.96 beats by $0.43. Revenue of $717M (+26.3% Y/Y)...

    Valmont Industries (NYSE:VMI): Q1 EPS of $1.96 beats by $0.43. Revenue of $717M (+26.3% Y/Y) beats by $48M. Shares +5.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK) guides on its Q1 earnings call (webcast) for Q2 revenue of $950M-$1.05B, below a...

    SanDisk (SNDK) guides on its Q1 earnings call (webcast) for Q2 revenue of $950M-$1.05B, below a consensus of $1.31B. 2012 sales are expected to fall from 2011 levels (consensus is for 4.1% growth). SanDisk is also guiding for a Q2 gross margin of just 26%-30% (down from Q4's 42.9%), and says some phone OEMs are reducing memory card capacity. SanDisk's lack of exposure to Apple and Samsung appears to be hurting its market position. SNDK -7.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM | 2 Comments
  • FSL

    In tandem with its Q1 report, Freescale Semiconductor (NYSE:FSL) announces chairman and CEO Rich...

    In tandem with its Q1 report, Freescale Semiconductor (NYSE:FSL) announces chairman and CEO Rich Beyer, who has held the top job since 2008, plans to retire. Freescale's board has begun searching for a successor. Shares are down 3.6% AH, likely affected both by the CEO news and Freescale's Q2 guidance for revenue of $975M-$1.025B (consensus stands at $1.02B). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD) guides on its Q1 earnings call (webcast) for revenue of $193M-$197M and...

    Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD) guides on its Q1 earnings call (webcast) for revenue of $193M-$197M and EPS of $0.21-$0.22, below a consensus of $202M and $0.24. 2012 sales growth guidance is lowered to 15% from 17%-20%. Shares, already pressured by the Q1 revenue miss, are now down 15% AH. With Riverbed having completed the product transition blamed in January for its soft Q1 guidance, fears of share loss have to be running high.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM | 6 Comments
  • RMBS

    Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS): Q1 EPS of -$0.25 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $62.9M (+0.6% Y/Y) in-line....

    Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS): Q1 EPS of -$0.25 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $62.9M (+0.6% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -6.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • EXTR

    Extreme Networks (NASDAQ:EXTR) -14.6% AH after warning it expects FQ3 (ended April 1) revenue of...

    Extreme Networks (NASDAQ:EXTR) -14.6% AH after warning it expects FQ3 (ended April 1) revenue of $73M-$73.5M and EPS of $0.04, below a consensus of $82.4M and $0.07. Extreme, which has struggled to compete with Cisco, Juniper, Brocade, and other networking vendors, blames its shortfall on sales execution (Polycom used the same excuse), lower sales to wireless service providers, and macro issues.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • LSCC

    Lattice Semiconductor (NASDAQ:LSCC): Q1 EPS of -$0.07 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $71.7M (-13.2%...

    Lattice Semiconductor (NASDAQ:LSCC): Q1 EPS of -$0.07 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $71.7M (-13.2% Y/Y) misses by $0.8M. Shares -4.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • FSL

    Freescale Semiconductor (NYSE:FSL): Q1 EPS of -$0.04 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $950M (-6.2%...

    Freescale Semiconductor (NYSE:FSL): Q1 EPS of -$0.04 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $950M (-6.2% Y/Y) misses by $11M. Shares +0.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • EZPW

    EZCORP (NASDAQ:EZPW): FQ2 EPS of $0.73 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $256M (+20.2% Y/Y) beats by...

    EZCORP (NASDAQ:EZPW): FQ2 EPS of $0.73 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $256M (+20.2% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Shares -4.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • COF

    More on Capital One (NYSE:COF): Domestic credit card profits +30.4% Q/Q, net charge-off rate -15...

    More on Capital One (NYSE:COF): Domestic credit card profits +30.4% Q/Q, net charge-off rate -15 bps to 3.92%, delinquencies -41 bps to 3.25%. Credit card balances off $3.4B Q/Q to $53.2B. Nearly all other metrics skewed by ING Direct acquisition, which was completed during the quarter. Shares +1.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • AMD

    More on AMD's Q1: Company expects Q2 revenue of $1.59B-$1.68B, compares favorably with $1.59B...

    More on AMD's Q1: Company expects Q2 revenue of $1.59B-$1.68B, compares favorably with $1.59B consensus. PC CPU revenue -8% Q/Q (seasonality) and flat Y/Y, with ASPs declining from Q4 (evidence of price competition?). Graphics processor revenue flat Q/Q and -7% Y/Y, with ASPs rising Y/Y due to new products. Gross margin was flat Q/Q at 46% in spite of revenue drop. AMD +1.9% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • ETFC

    More on E-Trade (NASDAQ:ETFC): Q1 beats across the board despite a 9% Y/Y decline in revenue....

    More on E-Trade (NASDAQ:ETFC): Q1 beats across the board despite a 9% Y/Y decline in revenue. Net profit climbed 38% over the same year ago period, bolstered by a $26M tax benefit and a 38% decline in its loan-loss provision - a key metric for investors because it reflects the company's recovery from bad bets made on the U.S. housing market. Shares +2.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • CPHD

    Cepheid (NASDAQ:CPHD): Q1 EPS of -$0.08 may not be comparable to consensus of -$0.01. Revenue of...

    Cepheid (NASDAQ:CPHD): Q1 EPS of -$0.08 may not be comparable to consensus of -$0.01. Revenue of $77.3M (+28.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -8.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • TPX

    Tempur-pedic International (NYSE:TPX): Q1 EPS of $0.86 may not be comparable to consensus of...

    Tempur-pedic International (NYSE:TPX): Q1 EPS of $0.86 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.84. Revenue of $384M (+18% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -10.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 3 Comments
  • MSFT

    More on Microsoft's FQ3: Windows division revenue +4% Y/Y, a sharp turnaround from FQ2's 6% drop...

    More on Microsoft's FQ3: Windows division revenue +4% Y/Y, a sharp turnaround from FQ2's 6% drop and a positive for the PC industry. Office division +9%, a notable pickup from FQ2's +3%. Server & Tools +14% (+11% prior), fueled by SQL Server and System Center. Entertainment & Devices -16% (+15% prior) due to soft console market, swings from a $210M profit to a $229M loss. Online Services (Bing) remains a cash sinkhole, losing $479M. MSFT +2.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • WDC

    More on SanDisk (SNDK): Q1 comes in line on revenue but misses on a per share basis due to a...

    More on SanDisk (SNDK): Q1 comes in line on revenue but misses on a per share basis due to a decline in revenue. Net income fell 49% Y/Y as its bottom line was negatively impacted by lower-than-expected pricing and demand weakness in certain segments. The company adds that it sees similar negative trends in Q2 as well. Shares -1.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed Technology (NASDAQ:RVBD): Q1 EPS of $0.20 in-line. Revenue of $183M (+11.6% Y/Y) misses...

    Riverbed Technology (NASDAQ:RVBD): Q1 EPS of $0.20 in-line. Revenue of $183M (+11.6% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares -9.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • ETFC

    E*TRADE Financial (NASDAQ:ETFC): Q1 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $489M (-9% Y/Y)...

    E*TRADE Financial (NASDAQ:ETFC): Q1 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $489M (-9% Y/Y) beats by $22M. Shares -2.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • COF

    Capital One (NYSE:COF): Q1 EPS of $1.56 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $4.9B (+21% Y/Y) misses by...

    Capital One (NYSE:COF): Q1 EPS of $1.56 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $4.9B (+21% Y/Y) misses by $300M. Shares +2.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK): Q1 EPS of $0.63 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $1.21B (-8% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    SanDisk (SNDK): Q1 EPS of $0.63 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $1.21B (-8% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • MSFT

    Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT): FQ3 EPS of $0.60 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $17.41B (+6% Y/Y) beats by...

    Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT): FQ3 EPS of $0.60 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $17.41B (+6% Y/Y) beats by $230M. Shares +1.8% AH. Company lowers FY12 operating expense guidance to  $28.3B-$28.7B ($28.5B-$28.9B prior). Establishes preliminary FY13 opex guidance of $30.3B-$30.9B. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • QCOM

    Gene Munster thinks Qualcomm (QCOM -6.6%) and TSMC's (NYSE:TSM) 28nm chip supply issues suggest...

    Gene Munster thinks Qualcomm (QCOM -6.6%) and TSMC's (NYSE:TSM) 28nm chip supply issues suggest Apple (AAPL -3.4%) will introduce its next iPhone in October, given the device is expected to feature a 28nm Qualcomm modem and A6 chip. Qualcomm's chip guidance could be contributing to today's selloff in Apple (along with Canaccord's note and Verizon's iPhone data), though its worth noting the iPhone 4S and new iPad don't use 28nm parts.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 23 Comments
  • HUSA

    A double dose of bad news for Houston American Energy (HUSA -35%), which says the SEC is...

    A double dose of bad news for Houston American Energy (HUSA -35%), which says the SEC is investigating possible securities violations and has subpoenaed its executives, and says it is halting efforts to test and complete certain formations in the Tamandua #1 sidetrack well in Colombia due to possible formation damage.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • COCO

    Corinthian Colleges (COCO +5.5%) is upgraded to Equal Weight from Underweight with an increased...

    Corinthian Colleges (COCO +5.5%) is upgraded to Equal Weight from Underweight with an increased price target by Barclays, which believes regulatory and other risks have begun to subside. However, the firm also says a rebound in the for-profit education industry isn't likely to emerge when companies report their latest quarterly earnings.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • QIHU

    Qihoo 360 (QIHU +18.4%) shares soar after the Chinese internet company surprises critics (I, II)...

    Qihoo 360 (QIHU +18.4%) shares soar after the Chinese internet company surprises critics (I, II) by filing its annual report on form 20F, which auditors signed off on and didn't include an auditor change.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM | 2 Comments
  • APOL

    Apollo (APOL -1.7%) shares fall to a 52-week low on news the SEC contacted the for-profit...

    Apollo (APOL -1.7%) shares fall to a 52-week low on news the SEC contacted the for-profit educator seeking information about insider stock sales and a Feb. 28 regulatory filing which said the company estimated it would enroll fewer new students. Shares have fallen ~35% since the Feb. outlook warning.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • PENN

    Penn National Gaming (PENN +2.9%) CEO Peter Carlino tips off on an earnings CC that the company...

    Penn National Gaming (PENN +2.9%) CEO Peter Carlino tips off on an earnings CC that the company is "ready, willing, and able" to make an acquisition on the Las Vegas Strip if the right property came along in a clear indication that the gaming operator is willing to expand out of core markets. He also drops a hint rather heavy with innuendo that a key exec is currently in China. (Earlier: earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +2.1%) outperforms as Bloomberg reports the company is leaning towards...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +2.1%) outperforms as Bloomberg reports the company is leaning towards picking JPMorgan as its strategic adviser, and could make a final decision in days. RIM's unwillingness to consider a sale as part of its strategic review, along with doubts about its ability to license BlackBerry 10 to leading OEMs, has limited investor enthusiasm.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 4 Comments
  • BX

    Blackstone (BX -4.6%) shareholders probably aren’t the only ones feeling blue over...

    Blackstone (BX -4.6%) shareholders probably aren’t the only ones feeling blue over lackluster Q1 results, as M&A bankers and PE rivals don't the firm's bleak talk about the dealmaking environment: “Emerging markets are slowing, Europe is weak... corporations want to sit on cash... fundraising is tough... most big funds are going to be much smaller than they were before."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • AAL

    US Airways (LCC +11.1%) spikes higher on a report American Airlines' (AAMRQ.PK) 3 largest unions...

    US Airways (LCC +11.1%) spikes higher on a report American Airlines' (AAMRQ.PK) 3 largest unions have agreed to support a takeover bid rather than keep the airline independent. The unions are said to believe they can obtain better terms from US Airways than from an independent, restructured AMR. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 2 Comments
  • FHN

    Shares of First Horizon (FHN -8%) sink after the bank's Q1 earnings fell 24% as it set aside...

    Shares of First Horizon (FHN -8%) sink after the bank's Q1 earnings fell 24% as it set aside more money for loan losses. Wunderlich says although results fell short of expectations, FHN will continue to improve its bottom-line performance as it emerges from this credit cycle, suggesting share weakness offers an attractive entry point for investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • CY

    Cypress Semiconductor (CY +12.2%) is taking off following its Q1 beat, which was accompanied by...

    Cypress Semiconductor (CY +12.2%) is taking off following its Q1 beat, which was accompanied by a 1.33 book/bill and provides more evidence of a chip industry recovery, and is also giving a boost to rival touchscreen controller vendor Atmel (ATML +2.6%). During its earnings call, Cypress guided for Q2 revenue of $200M-$207M and EPS of $0.17-$0.20; the former is in-line, but the latter is above a consensus of $0.16.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • TIBX

    More on Splunk: Though other big data software names sport high valuations, it looks as if...

    More on Splunk: Though other big data software names sport high valuations, it looks as if Splunk's takes the cake. The company has a market cap of $2.97B, which means it trades at 24.6x its FY12 (ended Jan. 31) revenue of $120.9M (+82% Y/Y). No P/E exists, since Splunk had a net loss of $11M. For reference, Tibco (NASDAQ:TIBX) trades at 5.8x sales, Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) at 7x, and Qlik Technologies (NASDAQ:QLIK) at 8x. SPLK +88.8%. (S-1)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM | 2 Comments
  • COL

    Rockwell Collins' (COL -3.9%) FQ2 profit rose 7.3% as a lower tax bill and stronger margins...

    Rockwell Collins' (COL -3.9%) FQ2 profit rose 7.3% as a lower tax bill and stronger margins helped the company offset continued weakness in its government business. But looking ahead, COL lowered its sales guidance for the year, citing its strategic decision to discontinue investment in public safety vehicle systems, among other items.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • SPLK

    Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK) delivers one of 2012's best IPOs. Shares of the machine data analysis...

    Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK) delivers one of 2012's best IPOs. Shares of the machine data analysis software vendor are currently trading at $32.13, up 89% from an IPO price of $17, which itself was revised higher a couple of times. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 4 Comments
  • IDTI

    Integrated Device Technology (IDTI +5.1%) shares surge after activist investor Starboard Value...

    Integrated Device Technology (IDTI +5.1%) shares surge after activist investor Starboard Value and affiliates reported a 6.5% stake in the chip company, according to an SEC filing.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • FFIV

    A common thread to the market-pleasing earnings reports delivered by F5 (FFIV +11.3%), VMware...

    A common thread to the market-pleasing earnings reports delivered by F5 (FFIV +11.3%), VMware (VMW +4.4%), and Mellanox (MLNX +43.5%) is that bulls have predicted each company would benefit (I, II) from Intel's (NASDAQ:INTC) Romley launch. Thus the reports could indicate other enterprise IT names expected to benefit will also deliver solid reports. Certain peers are rallying: RVBD +3.6%. RHT +2%. CTXS +1.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • CLR

    Continental Resources (CLR +3.5%) says it expects Q1 production to average ~85,000 boepd, a 13%...

    Continental Resources (CLR +3.5%) says it expects Q1 production to average ~85,000 boepd, a 13% gain Q/Q and 65% Y/Y. CLR says it is operationally ahead of plan for the year while reducing its operated drilling rigs, as scheduled.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • PLCM

    Polycom (PLCM -2.5%) makes fresh 52-week lows again after posting its Q1 report. The...

    Polycom (PLCM -2.5%) makes fresh 52-week lows again after posting its Q1 report. The videoconferencing gear vendor, recently crushed by a warning suggesting share losses to Cisco are growing, is guiding for Q2 revenue of $367M-$377M and EPS of $0.20-$0.22, below a consensus of $387.6M and $0.25. During its earnings call, Polycom blamed its woes on weak government demand, sales execution issues, and an industry shift to unified communications solutions.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • S

    Sprint (S -4.4%) responds back to allegations it owes New York more than $300M in unpaid taxes...

    Sprint (S -4.4%) responds back to allegations it owes New York more than $300M in unpaid taxes and penalties. "We have collected and paid every penny of sales tax owed to New York."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 29 Comments
  • S

    Sprint (S -4.8%) sells off after New York's AG files a $300M+ tax fraud suit. The carrier is...

    Sprint (S -4.8%) sells off after New York's AG files a $300M+ tax fraud suit. The carrier is accused of failing to bill customers for $100M+ worth of taxes over 7 years, in order to make its service more competitive. Fears likely exist that other states will file similar suits.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 4 Comments
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK -1.7%) CEO Stephen Elop says sales of its new Lumia smartphones have been mixed and...

    Nokia (NOK -1.7%) CEO Stephen Elop says sales of its new Lumia smartphones have been mixed and he will "deeply" discount the devices to spur sales to compete with Asian rivals in emerging markets. The move is announced as NOK reported heavy Q1 losses and said the executive in charge of its worldwide sales force was leaving the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 11 Comments
  • SWKS

    Qualcomm's light baseband chip guidance and iPhone worries (I, II) are pressuring shares of...

    Qualcomm's light baseband chip guidance and iPhone worries (I, II) are pressuring shares of mobile RF component makers. Skyworks (SWKS -3.1%), which has rallied on iPhone 5 hopes, is selling off the most, but TriQuint (TQNT -1.7%), RF Micro Devices (RFMD -0.9%), and Avago (AVGO -1.4%) are also trading lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • ACHN

    Wells Fargo weighs in on the collapse in shares of Achillion (ACHN -17.1%), calling the selling...

    Wells Fargo weighs in on the collapse in shares of Achillion (ACHN -17.1%), calling the selling frenzy tied to Hepatitis-C news (I, II) an "overreaction." Separately, UBS clients woke up to find a less-than-timely Sell rating on ACHN out from the firm waiting for them in their inbox.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • ASNA

    Charming Shoppes (CHRS +1.9%) spikes higher - after sitting in negative territory most of the...

    Charming Shoppes (CHRS +1.9%) spikes higher - after sitting in negative territory most of the day - as chatter percolates that the company is a takeover candidate. Shares are on a 26.3% YTD run as various reports of a bid for the apparel retailer have come and gone.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • EBAY

    eBay (EBAY +16%) is now making new 52-week highs on the back of its Q1 beat and strong PayPal...

    eBay (EBAY +16%) is now making new 52-week highs on the back of its Q1 beat and strong PayPal data. Piper is joining Benchmark in upgrading shares in response; though the firm doesn't see much earnings upside over the next 2 years, it expects bullishness about PayPal's mobile payments position to drive shares higher. PayPal expects to handle $7B worth of mobile payments in 2012, up from 2011's $4B. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • BTU

    A stellar earnings report from Peabody Energy (BTU +6.9%) - fueled in part by production gains...

    A stellar earnings report from Peabody Energy (BTU +6.9%) - fueled in part by production gains in Australia - spills over to help lift up other select names in the beat-up sector along with word that U.S. coal exports to China may double in 2012. Advancers: PCX +6.6%, ANR +3.8%, CNX +2.8%, ACI +6.5%, ARLP +4.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • NYT

    The New York Times (NYT +6.7%) surges following its Q1 earnings beat, which suggests...

    The New York Times (NYT +6.7%) surges following its Q1 earnings beat, which suggests restructuring efforts are bearing fruit. The rally comes even though the Times reported a 2.3% drop in digital ad revenue, as its paywall takes a toll on pageviews. Paid digital subscriptions totaled 472K as of March 18, up from 406K at the end of Q4, and the Times is trying to further boost subscriptions by reducing free access.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • GNTX

    Shares of Gentex (GNTX -9.0%) tilt lower after reporting in-line results on both its top and...

    Shares of Gentex (GNTX -9.0%) tilt lower after reporting in-line results on both its top and bottom lines. Traders seem to be latching on to the firm's forecast for Q2 revenue that is below the estimates of analysts, as well as the outlook for flat sales of shipments of rear camera displays during the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • TUMI

    Luggage maker Tumi (NYSE:TUMI) hits the ground running with its IPO. After pricing at $18, Tumi...

    Luggage maker Tumi (NYSE:TUMI) hits the ground running with its IPO. After pricing at $18, Tumi shares are changing hands at $26.29 - marking a 45.9% launch - although only 18.78M shares are up for offer.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM

  • Stocks quickly bounce back from a sizable hit following a trio of worse-than-expected economic...

    Stocks quickly bounce back from a sizable hit following a trio of worse-than-expected economic reports (I, II, III). The DJIA +0.2% after being down 70 and the Nasdaq +0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 4 Comments
  • PENN

    Penn National Gaming (PENN +5.5%) rides a solid earnings beat higher, helped in part by a mild...

    Penn National Gaming (PENN +5.5%) rides a solid earnings beat higher, helped in part by a mild winter that drove customers off their couches and to Penn's properties. The gaming concern ups its guidance for FY2012, now seeing EPS falling in at $2.48 comparing favorably to a prior estimate of $2.22 and the $2.27 consensus mark of analysts. Shares etched out a 52-week high before falling back a tad.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • FFIV

    F5 (FFIV +11%) surges towards its 52-week high after delivering FQ2 results and FQ3 guidance...

    F5 (FFIV +11%) surges towards its 52-week high after delivering FQ2 results and FQ3 guidance that calmed fears (I, II) of slowing sales, and validated bulls (I, II) who argued demand remains healthy. Capstone and Wunderlich are upgrading F5 to Buy in response; the latter praises F5's record gross margin and strong book/bill, and (like Merrill) expects Intel's Romley server CPUs to boost demand for F5's switches. (transcript)
